description: Creates a target for your Traffic Mirror session.

unverifiedMitreAttackTechniques.reason: When a Traffic Mirror target is created, it enables the capture of network traffic, which can be analyzed to understand the network configuration, including IP addresses, subnets, and routing.
Mirrored traffic provides visibility into the types of services running on the network, allowing adversaries to map out the network services and identify potential vulnerabilities.
By examining the mirrored traffic, attackers can identify and understand the protocols used at the application layer, which can be exploited for further attacks.
The data captured through traffic mirroring can be exfiltrated via web services, making it easier for attackers to move large amounts of data without detection.
Traffic mirroring can uncover the use of non-standard ports, which can then be targeted in later stages of the attack for covert command and control communications.
The detailed information gathered from traffic mirroring helps attackers build a comprehensive profile of the victim's network.
By analyzing the traffic within a cloud environment, adversaries can discover cloud infrastructure details and configurations, which can be critical for planning further attacks.
Analysis of mirrored traffic can reveal information about system owners or users, which can be leveraged for further attacks.
Mirrored traffic can reveal sensitive data being transmitted within the network, which can be captured and analyzed.
Traffic mirroring enables the continuous collection of network traffic, which can then be automatically exfiltrated for further analysis or exploitation.

securityImplications: Attackers might use CreateTrafficMirrorTarget to establish destinations for mirrored traffic, potentially facilitating the unauthorized observation or capture of sensitive information.
